category.name: Family Prayers
category.description: Prayers for family devotion and spiritual growth

content.text:
MY FATHER,
If Your mercy had a limit, where could I possibly hide from what I deserve?
But Your love in Christ has no limits.

So I'm coming to You with all my sins—
the wrong things I've done and the right things I've left undone.
I've sinned against You, my Father;
against You, my amazing Savior;
against You and Your work in me, Holy Spirit;
against my own conscience and the Bible's teaching;
and against my neighbors and myself.

Please don't judge me,
because I have no good deeds of my own to point to,
and no excuses to hide my sin.
Forgive this day that has been darkened by my wrongdoings.

Tonight, I turn back to You with a sorry heart.
Every morning I promise to love You more passionately, to serve You more sincerely, to be more devoted, to be completely Yours.
Yet I always stumble and fall backward, and have to confess my own weakness and sin.

But I thank You that the finished work of Jesus doesn't need anything added by me;
His sacrifice is more than enough to cover all my sins.

If You give me more days to live, help me to change my life,
to truly hate what is evil,
and to run from the very sins I'm confessing now.
Make me more determined, more alert, and more prayerful.

Please don't let bad things grow from the wrong seeds I've planted with my actions.
Don't let my carelessness cause someone else to get stuck in their own pride and foolishness.
If today I have been ashamed of Christ or His Word, or if I've been unkind, hateful, envious, unloving, spoken without thinking, had a quick temper, or brought dishonor to Your name, please forgive me.

O help me to set a good example—one that pushes back against what's wrong, attracts people to what's good, and proves that the ways of Christ are beautiful.
